From the moment you walk in the door till the moment you leave the place gives you a feel like you are in the middle of an Italian mob movie. I liked how it was dark in there it really set the mood, and the little lights connected to your menu to see it better. I loved it. We got there a bit late and were the only ones in the place which was fine. The service was exceptional. He ordered a captain and coke which tasted like a glass of captain and a drop of coke (always good). First came the bread and the garlic butter that came with it was what made the bread awesome, it would have been nothing special with out it. Then the salads, I got the house salad with Italian dressing. It was honestly the best house salad ever, it had marinated tomatoes and artichoke hearts on it and the dressing was incredible. I ordered Uncle Pauly's Arrabiata, just the right amount of spicy for a pasta dish. I loved it. He ordered the Alfredo and bragged about how awesome it was all night.

Ahaha this place is awesome, and the food is super good!. How could you make a broccoli taste soo delicious?, you bite the broccoli and its burst with deliciousness . Not to mention the awesome theme, I'll be back for sure!!!!

What a great experience! The outside does not reflect the inside at all and it had a hilarious secret entrance that took me by surprise. The whole environment was very unique. It was dark, very cozy and had lighting in the right places. The waitress was very attentive and was always checking in with us. There was a man singing who had an amazing baritone voice and sang Frank Sinatra songs throughout our dinner. The appetizers were cooked perfectly and the entrees were delicious. I wasn't even done with my dinner and was completely full, didn't know what to do with myself when they brought the dessert menu. I went ahead and ordered the creme brûlée  and it was delicious. The prices are fair compared to other Italian restaurants and much better in my opinion. I will definitely be returning to try other dishes. There were a few negatives that caught our attention. The host was very friendly to me but never directed a word to my boyfriend. He wasn't mean or rude but he didn't seem to acknowledge his presence. I noticed this with other groups as well. Another was that they didn't have a beer list or menu. The waitress didn't really know all the available beers to choose from. The last one is in regards to space. There was a party of 8 that were seated in front of us and it was quite awkward trying to maneuver our way to the exit. We had to ask a few people to move their chair so we could get out. All minor negatives compared to the food.

This was and is the best place for Italian food not only is is good but you get the full Italian experience...this place makes olive garden look like chuck e cheese... if your in Vegas this place is a must and ps. Bring your hunger your gonna need it...

Excellent food and atmosphere. The entrance is a trip with the fake door and hidden window. Service is a bit slow but the food was delicious. Had the chicken piccata with mushroom risotto and would order it again. The rest of the table loves their meal too. Dessert....equally good. Go!

I brought relatives there from out of town who were celebrating their 30th anniversary. Since our family is Italian descent, we all grew up on homemade Italian food. Capo's food is "authtic Italian", not like the Olive Garden variety. The mob/speakeasy theme makes eating there more of an experience and is really quite fun! The decor is very era appropriate. It is quite dark inside, but they provide small lights for reading the menu.

I mentioned to the manager that we were celebrating a 30th wedding anniversary. I thought maybe he would have his wait staff bring them out a piece of cake with a candle or something in recognition as other restaurants often do. He did nothing at all. That is really the only fault I have to find with my experience at Capo's.

BTW...the meatball appetizer is fantastic...a must try when you go!

My type of place!

This place is truly fantastic- a hidden Vegas gem. Dark and intimate with a ton of history. Went with a few friends and enjoyed excellent Italian cuisine along with great service, and table-side entertainment.

Although they do have a bar I would recommend making a reservation to really take this place in and do the full dining experience. 

One issue was that the music (a great old-style live singer) was a little too loud, we could barley hear each other talk but it wasn't like that the whole time and I still give them 5 stars because we had fun and I was impressed.
Great Italian food. Great Sinatra music playing all night. Everything was excellent from service to desert. Try out the cigar room in the back.

If you like the mob life you'll love this joint.  Live crooner sinjng the old tunes and he sings them so well.  Food is good Italian fare which is hard to mess up.   The atmosphere is what makes this place special.  Dark dimly lit.   Total mobster speak easy feel

This is a great place! We went out for a date night and all expectations were met or exceeded. From the password that was required for entry to the dessert at the end of the meal. Brandon our server took great care of us. He was polite and checked in on us just enough so that we never wanted for anything. I had the pasta arrabiatta ,
the Mrs. had the eggplant parmigiana. Both excellent. The starter, garlic cheese bread and Caesar salad were great! We had a couple of cocktails and a bottle of Chianti for dinner and all was well. Check this place out. It's worth the drive if you're a tourist staying on the strip.

I really wanted to like this place, but the poor service, long delay of our food, and overall neglect of my table made for a disappointing experience. 

I think the secret door is a cool idea in theory and I love the entire Italian mob theme of this restaurant but I think asking if people have reservations and then making it seem like an inconvenience to seat you if you don't isn't smart business. We showed up before 4 pm and the host staff innocently argued in front of us about being unsure if they could seat us in the restaurant that had one table with people sitting at it. 

My partners beer showed up ten minutes after we ordered it and we waited a solid thirty minutes for my eggplant parmigiana and his sausage and peppers. My dish was good, and a very large portion which I was happy to see for the hefty $21 price, but the sausage and peppers were overly salty for my taste.

We didn't see our server too much, she was busy tending to a larger party that was seated after us. Our water lacked refills, we weren't checked on after our dinner was dropped off, and when we asked for a dessert menu she dropped off a closed book but when we opened it there was no menu inside. She didn't come back for 10 minutes so we decided to not even order anything because it would have taken even longer. 

I would like to come back for the live music, but it will probably be later then sooner.

Enjoyed thoroughly.  
Very entertaining.  Strong drinks. Great food.  Fun atmosphere.  Live singer doing old time croons. Enjoy!   About $60 per person including drinks.

Awesome meatballs, must have!!!! We had them as an appetizer and ate them all. Everything else was great. Service a little slower at times, but the food makes up for it. Coming back next time we're in Vegas.

Right off the bat, to only give Capo's one-star, this is a tough one for us because we went out of our way to make sure and have dinner here with the kids, knowing they also enjoy that old-school feel, not to mention their entertainer, Kevin DeCosta. He's very good! 

In addition, regarding our uneventful night, I should point out that I did contact a Manager. I spoke to Dominic (sp?). He was very kind and apologetic. He said that the next time we're in town, let him know. He'll make sure it will be a more enjoyable moment. That's cool and I appreciate his offer. But that doesn't erase the fact of what had happened that night. What was worse - it wasn't just one bad thing. It was three consecutive mistakes, one right after the other, and all by the same person, our server, ASHLEY. 

1. When a salad is included with your dinner order, the server will read off the choices. Easy, right? Most of us know this drill, simple. Done. Not exactly. Ashley read off the choices of salads that come with our dinner, including Caesar Salad. We ordered Caesar. 

2. Cocktails. We ordered two Vodka Collins. Easy to make. A regular drink for us. Unless specified, unless we "call" the type of Vodka, the establishment will give you House Vodka. 

3. The bill.  Just over $160.00. We pay with cash,  2-one hundred dollar bills. Easy math. 200 minus 160, forty dollars change. Give or take the loose change. But still, simple math, nothing hard. 

But here's the thing... Although she reads off the salads as if they were our choices that come with the dinners, the Caesar salads were actually an extra charge. Not once did she say something along the lines of "Caesar is extra, is that okay?"  If she had mentioned this, I promise you we would have said "yes, that's good." Instead, she decided to keep this bit of info from us. 

Our Vodka drinks. Although we did our usual ordering of "Vodka Collins", and not a "Call drink", she went ahead and used Kettle One Vodka, not a house Vodka. In other words, yes, there was an extra charge for that, too.

Our bill. Knowing we should receive approximately forty dollars back, Ashley returned with the change. She left. We opened it, double checked everything, and btw, this is when we also saw the above problems. But to top it off... she didn't short change us fifty cents, not even one dollar. We were short ten dollars! 

To have these three things happen all on the same night by the same server, and they all have to do with money... I mean, it has to really make you think. In our eyes, this was not a mistake anymore. She clearly deceived us. Definitely not a good thing. You can accidentally give us ranch dressing over blue cheese. Marinara sauce over Meat sauce. But to not state that there's an extra charge for a Caesar; to assume we wanted Kettle One; and to take an additional ten dollars from OUR money?!!!!  However way you want to look at it, it comes down to this, especially since we were the ones to have the unfortunate experience... Ashley was either told by the company to do this. Or she took it upon herself to take us for our money. Big mistake. 

I'll say this again - I did reach out to their Manager. Dominic did offer make things right. I don't know what that entails, but he seemed kind and professional. The experience was the worse we have ever had ANYWHERE. However, my kids like that old-school feel. So if we happen to take a trip to Vegas soon, maybe... just maybe we'll give it another shot. But after what happened, that's really a tough one. And if we do and all is 100% better, I'll revise this review, but until then, that was a terrible way to lose customers. Very deceiving. The thought is more like this, "After what had happened, can we trust them?"

To recommend this place would be wrong on my part to the reader. It's clearly spelled out for you, so this is an easy one. If you're looking for that special dinner to go to tonight or the weekend, regardless if you're a local or  visitor, I have to say it might be wise to do the extra homework and browse the many restaurants in Las Vegas and the surrounding areas. Like I said, we're not talking accidentally being served ranch over blue cheese... this is money. Money taken from us. Because of this, Capo's has lost our respect and trust. 

And so now as you're deciding, you have to remember: It's your money and it's always your choice.

If you love Italian food, STAY AWAY FROM THIS DIVE! Save the time, money and effort and go to Albertsons and buy a $1 Michelinas microwave dinner. That's what this stuff reminded me of. Italian food is not that difficult, yet so many places mess it up, and this place tops that list! $20 for a piece of lasagna that tasted like mush and was the size of cigarette pack. Hot ceasar salad with rock hard croutons and stale bread. The ambiance was horrible. I went with a party of six and they stuck us in a makeshift table in the isle next to the bar where everyone walking in or to the bathroom had to bump into us. The lighting is so bad that they have to put small lights on the menus. Some Sinatra wannabe singing so loud that I couldn't hear the people at my own table. The only bright spot was a well made Cherry Coke and a nice waitress who knew what a joke her work environment is. If you like the stereo typical wiseguy theme Italian restaurant, then this place is for you, right down to the secret entrance. You'll get a better bang for your buck at Fazolis so save yourself the heartache and skip this place, I wish I had...

Great Italian ambiance with live music for entertainment & real Italian cuisine!  They even had an excellent magician when we were there.  Recommend this off the beaten path Vegas restaurant.  About 10 minutes from the strip.

Overall, it was a good experience! got a groupon $30 for $60. I feel like our waitress put us off to the side after she got sat with another party who probably didnt have a groupon. 
food wise, this place was great! My boyfriend got the spaghetti and huge meatball and I got the penne a la vodka with chicken. We only go to a handful of Italuan spots in L.A. because we like authentic Italian. We will definitely be back for the food! The ambiance was really cool too! Red velvet and read leather, dark with small chandeliers. The entrance to this spot was a real treat, makes you feel like a mobster, especially after going to the mob attraction at the Tropicana, Fogetaboutit!
Don't forget the calamari and red wine! 
Only downside is that it is off the strip and getting a taxi is pricey! From the Tropicana to Capo's was $25 one way!
Great food! Fun atmosphere. Wish the waiters stuck with the theme.... The waiters were nice and helpful but I kinda wanted them to give us some Italian mafia attitude.

I found this place on a business trip years ago and have been going ever since. This time had an opportunity to take the entire family and they loved it! Not what you would consider a traditionally great place for kids but my son, nephew and niece loved the whole hidden entry/password thing, and the lounge act and "mob bosses" were very nice and accommodating, and went the extra step to keep them entertained (please, be sure to grease a few palms). I have always found the food to be great and this time everyone in a pretty decent sized party loved what  they ordered and, amazingly, got their dishes all at the same time. That was the first time this entire trip that there wasn't some issue with at least one order. Our waiter was a great kid and worked hard, and even the guys who helps him out bringing water etc was fantastic! The price for a large party was not bad at all considering we had paid almost exactly the same the night before for basic bar food. You know you had a great meal when your back at home and the family is still talking about the food at Capo's!

Food was phenomenal as always, service was stellar. We always come here for our pasta cravings and Sinatra music. Best in town in my oppinion. Recommend to any couples or special events with a loved one or family. Will always come back no matter what.
Fantastic, great experience.  Duck soup was great!

This place was amazing!  Totally lives up the hype! Love the secret door, the Frank Sinatra singer and the awesome magician that came around made our night!  OUR FOOD WAS AMAZING!  The steak was off the hook and the creamy italian dressing was unreal! I can't wait to come back to Vegas and eat here again!  Thanks Capo's you guys rock!

I went here for my bday dinner with friends . I love food - I love Italian . 

The bill overcharged my party of 13 by $11- which may not seem like a big deal but for a group of 13 people and how much they already made from us - I don't find this amusing . Me and my best friend use to come here when they first opened in 2010. Now, I picked this place for my bday dinner and it left a bad taste in my mouth . 

Yeah the singer sang to me , I ve came here with a friend prior and they do ladies night . But customer service needs to be so much better and in addition - you shouldn't ask a large party for extra gratuity . Gratuity is given - not asked for !  

Place could have more lighting ! Re-vamp your drink specials and your  2 for 1 deal !

Poor response time to the door. The waitress did great but was understaffed. The food was less than average and bland. The environment was very sexy and casual. Too bad the food wasn't better because the venue has real potential.

This place is wonderful.  I found the food actually some of the best real homemade italian food I have ever had.  The service is impeccable and not smothering.  I have been there twice in two weeks.  Love the ambience of the Speakeasy atmosphere. 
love it, will become a mainstay for italian food

I think Capo's deserves a 2.5 because of originality, but since the stars won't allow, and due to a big-time let down and poor quality, I'll round down.

My Dad was in town for his 60th Birthday and he wanted Italian food for a less than outrageous price.  We can be pretty picky with Italian food considering we are Italian, and the fact that we come from where Italian food is actually good (NY,Philly,NJ).  He suggested Maggiano's because we know to expect good quality.  I didn't want to take him to a chain though, I wanted him to have something he could only get in Vegas, so I did my homework on Yelp, and Capo's seemed like the right choice.  A choice I ended up regretting.

No horror stories here, but as you will read, the service and food quality just weren't there, the only thing good was the atmosphere.

Upon arrival the entry and speakeasy theme was pretty cool.  Would have been cooler without a sign that said credit cards were currently not accepted, cash only.  But still pretty cool.
Inside, the very dark environment with mafia decor and old Italian Resaurante style kept me looking around.  And an the old Vegas style lounge singer was belting out the Sinatra hits in a voice slightly better than my own (this is not a compliment to my voice).

From here it just goes down hill.

There was a half hour wait even though an entire room of tables was wide open, not being used.  I didn't realize we'd need a reso being it was a Tues night during the off-season and the place being in a hole in the wall off the beaten path.  Perhaps this was still my fault.

The service was bad.  Friendly enough, sure.  But we didn't get the water we asked for, and even after ordering we never got a basket of bread until such a long time went by that we waved down the waitress and begged for bread and water.  Then the bread came, and had I not been starving, I would have tossed it in the garbage.  This was possibly the worst bread I have ever tasted.  Is it possible for bread to be that bad?  Apparently it is.  Not just bad, but terribly stale.  I gobbled up the chewy, stale loaf anyway because I was so hungry from waiting, nearly ripping out teeth in the process.

The main course eventually came and it was all sub-par.  Edible, yes.  In an Olive Garden quality kind of way, maybe a bit worse.  The fettuccine alfredo seemed like it was straight outta the TV dinner box.  The added shrimp were a nice size.

My Dad got ravioli's in a red sauce with meatballs.  Again, just edible.  Especially since we were starving.  But a very generic taste all around.  I honestly felt embarrassed that I brought my Pop to eat this.

This is not a true Italian place.  It is a gimmicky eatery that makes it on its speakeasy theme atmosphere.  If you have ever had real Italian food, the taste of this food will be a total let down.

The evening was soo much fun - singing, magic, great food and what an entry!  We will go every time we happen to be in Las Vegas and have already suggested it to friends.  Loved the spinach soup ... looking for the receipe.

If you're craving for a fancy italian comfort food, then this is your perfect place! My boyfriend's dad took me and my bf to this place for dinner, and it was def a lot of fun. It started with finding the main entrance or the real one i must say and getting greeted by a scary host at the front. 

They have delicious food and great wine list! I love the live music and the magic tricks that will def blow your mind away! I definitely recommend this to everyone! Not only this restaurant is very historic, it also serves delicious food and great entertainment. It's 3 in 1 so i must say very worth the visit! 

(Just dont be fooled on how it looks outside, you'll be surprise once you're inside!!!)

Came here after seeing them on Mystery Diners. This place is a great experience and far exceeded my expectations. I came here with my husband on a Group On deal for lunch. Customer service was on point and food was good as well. I love the black and red decor. We had the caesar salad, lasagna and meatballs. Food tasted great and homemade

I was surprised to see all of these good reviews for Capos.  I thought it was just o.k, nothing great. There was no singer so maybe our experience would have been better if there was.  We visited on a Friday at 8PM and the place was pratically empty.  There were maybe 2 or 3 orther tables.  We had salad to start and the ceaser and house salads were soaked in salad dressing...way too much!  And be prepared for garlic, the salads were very garlicly, which I didn't mind.  I had the fish special that was encrusted in pine nuts.  It seemed more like a breadcrumb coating that I just pealed off.  For $35 I've had much better.  Someone ordered the The Chef Sleeps with Fishes which was good, but not oustanding.  If you're visiting LasVegas with a car and are intrigued by the 'theme" then it's probably worth your while assuming the singer other reviewers wrote about is there.  If you would need to rent a car or pay for a cab, I say skip it.

I came to Capo's because my coworkers suggested this restaurant. I brought my best friend for her birthday with other friends and everyone was so impressed with the food. The outside appearance might throw you off, but once you walk in, you'll absolutely adore it. Not only was the food delicious, the service was great! Our waitress attended us very well and made sure we were happy, and full. I recommend the cheese bread and meatballs for appetizers, and the ravioli for a main course! Be prepared to get stuffed. Come with a HUGE appetite. Oh, and if you are in the mood for a drink, try the red sangria! Simply delicious and refreshing.

Not only is this an awesome theme restaurant, it's also one of the Best Italian food in the Country. The entire atmosphere is a great place to take friends or even on a romantic date. The singer who does Frank Sinatra is FANTASTIC!!!!!  Order the Meatballs to start and you will be hooked. The bread, Butter, Pasta, Drinks, I could go on and on. You should be privileged to even get to eat at Capo's. This is a Legit Wise guy place. If your stuffy or have a stick up your ass or drink your wine with your pinkie finger out, or  you don't like the Italian attitude stay home or go to Wolfgang pucks. hahahaha

I love this place! I haven't even eaten here yet and my mind is blown! I love the decor and the the service. I have the a feeling the food is going to be amazing. My friend suggested this place and he's a chef...need I say more?

Disappointing is by far too nice of an adjective here.  My husband and I used to visit  Capos on Tropicana and always had a great experience.  Capos on Sahara is seriously a restaurant not associated with its past by any means. 
First upon arrival we were greeted in the interesting way at the speak-easy door by the maitre d.  We did not have a reservation and we were sat within 5 minute upon arrival.   While waiting I will add the maitre d was discussing how they were waiting for Anthony Bourdin to arrive...
We were sat and waited a good 10 minutes before being asked if we would like to order anything to drink.  when we finally ordered we were ready to finalize our entire meal order.  I ordered the calamari and linquini and clams.  my husband ordered the sausage ravioli .  
We were brought bread which I seriously thought looked and tasted like a crouton.  crunchy and dry.
when the wines were served I was unhappily surprised and how small the glass of red was.  for 12 dollars you would think the glass would be served 1/2 full however it was filled 1/4 full and the white was 3/4 full.
the calamari came and it tasted frozen and heated through.  
we finished the calamari and waited at least 25 min until our entrees came.  i knew after my first bite of the linquini and clams the "fresh pasta" wasnt fresh, the clams were very very chewy and the sauce tasted like it had tons of sugar in it.  i have never tasted linquine and clams white sauce quite like this before.  my husbands ravolis tasted ok but again the sauce didnt taste fresh more like Hunts Spaghetti Sauce out of the can.
i was looking forward to the bread pudding but after eating the entree i decided that if the appetizer and main were so bad i didnt think capos could recover with a good dessert so we decided to pass.
we live quite close to capos and and we decided to leave immediately following dinner.  my stomach was turning and I just wanted to get home.  not 2 minutes upon leaving did I tell my husband that i felt sick.  we were 1 block away from home and i made him pull over.  i could not hold it in , i tried but couldnt .  so with the overcooked possibly spoiled clams, not fresh made pasta, chewy calamari and old bread i had left on the pavement i am here at YELP making sure you all know how horrible my experience was.  I warn all to be very very careful here.   Anthony Bourdin will NOT be impressed!

It was difficult to give this restaurant stars because important things about a meal:  the food, atmosphere and service were above average.  Unfortunately, there were surprises on the bill at the end of the meal that put a damper on the whole experience.  The menu stated that there was a $5 charge for splitting.  We understood that but when the food came to the table it was not split up so we asked for another plate and I split it myself.  We thought--that's good, we won't be charged the $5 now.  Not only were we charged for the split, we were charged $3 more ($8) for it, because "they recently raised the price" (but didn't update the menu?).  On top of that we ordered the spaghetti Santucci which was good, but we thought the meatballs were included as one of the choices in the dish.  They added another $5 on for the meatballs too.  Our waiter got the manager when we complained.  He just apologized as did the waiter and said it was a management decision.  

So--I can't recommend the restaurant due to their billing practices.

Found this place pretty randomly as we were on vacation for a week in Vegas looking for interesting places to eat at.

This place has a very speakeasy-type feel to it, from the secret entrance to the dark ambience, to the decor, to the mobster movies playing on the TVs.

What we had:

Santucci's Pasta--this hit the spot for me!  I had been craving some simple, but special, spaghetti pasta and this met and exceeded all expectations!  Got it w the meatball and it just made my day...I would go back just for this dish...simple, but special.

Big Dom's Primavera--the Mrs had this and it looked amazing :-).  Full of fresh veggies of all types tossed in a light olive oil.  By the end of the meal, there wasn't a veggie left on the plate...enough said!

Da Mob Meatball Sandwich--the little one had this and she really did a number on it.  The meatballs are awesome and when you load them up in a sandwich, it was something that just makes your mouth water :-P

Truly a hidden gem in a pretty obscure area, but a place that I would seek out next time I am back in the City!

Happy eating!
Food was amazing!!!! Service was great!!went for lunch can't wait to try dinner..I love how dramatic d entrance was ^_^

Atrocious service. My trip here led to a shouting match with the manager. We purchased a groupon for a party of four. The other couple cancelled, and the restaurant manager refused to honor the groupon, even though it would have resulted in us spending more money than we would have.

Apparently they are all good on cash here, so don't bother giving them any of yours. Never had a worse dining, or in this case a "not-dining" experience in my life. 

Can't wait to see this place turned into more parking lot. Their terrible management is going to make that happen sooner than later.
Great foog and fun atmosphere! Gotta try the meatballs.

I have been going to this place for years, and I love it! From the live music to the unique atmosphere, this restaurant is a must for a date night or even the beginning to a night on the town. The prices are equivalent to that of a certain major Italian restaurant chain but the food and atmosphere are so much better. They do old school Las Vegas in a very classy way. This is definitely one of my most favorite restaurants in the Vegas area. This place would also be suitable for bringing guests that are from out of town.

Amazing restaurant! Came here on a Sunday evening for a friend's birthday and the whole experience was just so much fun. It had the feel of an old mob speakeasy from start to finish. Going on, you have to knock on an outside door and someone pops their head out of a side panel to see who you are. After confirming the reservation, you are let into a dimly let restaurant where the decor is clean, cool, and old school (with pictures of mobsters hanging up). The music was calm and easy, and by midway through the meal we had a live singer going around the tables. He was awesome. 

As for the food: absolutely amazing. I'm a vegetarian and was very happy with the selection. We started with the fried ricotta rivoli and had the soup (pasta fagioli, much like minestrone) or salad that came with our entrees. I then got the rigatoni trafficante (minus the prosciutto) and my friend got the shrimp alfredo. Everything was so delicious and clearly homemade. We would have gotten dessert but we were super stuffed. 

Over all, it's a bit out of the way (relative to the Strip) but definitely worth it, both for the experience and for the food. I highly recommend Capo's!

Atmosphere and music is great. Sat at the bar and the bartender was great. Food wasnt great. Calamari was rubbery and tasted old. Pasta was over cooked and a bit disapointing. Bartender offered us the cheesecake for dessert. We agreed just to have him come back and tell us there out of cheese cake. Saw the happy hour menu and that might make me stop by again to give them a chance.

Great Italian restaurant! My husband and I have been here a few times-it's one of our favorites when we are in town.  You have to ring the bell and they slide the door open like the prohibition days! So cool! The host was amazing and the live entertainment was a gentleman singing Frank Sinatra songs. The food was exceptional! I highly recommend the creamy garlic dressing on the salad. I also had the ravioli with a pink sauce that was incredible and the meatballs were equally delicious. The Anastasia chicken is a must-one of the best items on the menu.  I also had an Italian Margarita.  OH my!  It was the most delicious drink!  The wait staff is extremely attentive. It was a little dark, but I think that's the idea as part of the ambiance because the menus come with little flashlights attached. We will definitely be back!

No way dude. So over-rated. I am soooo pissed! 

Not sure if everyone giving this place rave reviews is from Iowa or something, but as someone who knows REAL Italian cooking and what to expect... skip this place. We were all so excited to try Capo's. Over 700 amazing reviews? Have we finally found our new place?

The food sucks. Bad. Extremely garlic-y, yet sauce is still bland and tasteless. Meatballs were nothing special. Cheeses don't taste fresh. Soup was weak, served in a tiny ass bowl with no gusto. The veal was horrible. Just horrible.

At one point I looked to my father, typical wise-guy type, and said "tourist trap?"- he laughed and shrugged it off. 
 
Our waitress moved at a glacial pace and the bussers were awkward and brought food out COLD. We actually had to send it back to the kitchen. That's mortifying. I could feel myself getting angrier and angrier as dinner wore on. 

You would think for over $200 for 4 people (one of them being 7 yrs old), the food would be fantastic.

Not so much.

At the end of the meal, dad looked over at me and said "tourist trap."  Guess the search continues.
All of The food was fantastic the ambiance and the entertainment wonderful!

First off, the ambiance and building are fantastic.  We got lost and missed our reservation and they were super helpful getting us another one the next night.  We were excited when we got there because it was a fantastic set up (although in a weird area for tourists).  They have a beautiful piano but no one played it.  Instead there was a man singing to a karaoke machine with Sinatra CD's.  There was a magician going table to table but he did not visit our table.   However, the food is mediocre at best.  The fried ravioli was obviously frozen then dropped in a fryer.  It was mushy and tasteless.  The salads were fine.  Romaine lettuce seemed fresh and dressing was fine.  It tasted over seasoned, but we could not identify the spice over used.  Basil???   I ordered the fetticcine  Alfredo with grilled chicken and it was awful.  The chicken was NOT grilled.  I'm pretty sure it was frozen, precooked chicken chunks.  The sauce was awful and did not taste fresh.  Husband had the lasagna and said it was not good.  He ate a little then said, "It's not even worth finishing".  Everything was over seasoned as if they use bottled sauce and just add seasoning to make it taste "better."  We did not bother with dessert.  So disappointing because it was NOT cheap.  The theme is really neat that's it.  Not fresh, not good, not tasty.

From the moment you walk in till the end of your meal the experience is fantastic. Make sure you have the have the password to get into this incredible Mob themed restaurant. Try the fried ravioli and the meatballs, main dish hands down, swim with the fishes shrimp pasta is the best you'l have! Make a full mobster day by visiting the Mob Museum first.
Food was amazing! I had the chicken Marsala and mushroom risotto which I couldn't finish because it was sooo much good. I totally recommend place.
Again this place is an excellent brunch choice!! Use the coupons from travel zoo and Groupon and you will be most pleased you made the trip.Time to try them for dinner!!!

Absolutely horrible service. 

After a great time at the mob museum, my date and I read some of the good reviews and decided we should check this place out.
I should have looked at the bad reviews too.
When we walked in, we pretty much got yelled at because they didn't open for another hour. We said okay fine, we'll be back. 
We went back an hour later, same guy opened the door and asked if we had a reservation. We said no. He said he has no room for us and we can just go and sit at the bar. He did a really offensive gesture and then walked off. 

Still standing there in shock, like umm did that really just happen.
We decided not to sit at the bar. Especially since we didn't know where the bar was, it's so dark you can't see anything in there.  We couldn't even see how to get out, so we had to wait for him to come back. When he finally did come back, we asked him why he didn't let us know we needed a reservation when we were there an hour earlier. He said 'now you know' and left.

I'm glad I didn't eat there. Ridiculous!

An Italian restaurant that feels like an old speakeasy. The ambience is unique with a secret entrance & a live Sinatra like performer who will sing at your table. There is the occasional magician or lady selling roses too. 

The service follows the old speakeasy feel. Reservations are recommended, otherwise try to grab a seat at the bar (which can be hard to come by). When you call to make a reservation you'll get an abrupt "yeah, " making it feel like you're part of a secret Italian meeting. You'll get the same "what do you want attitude" when you come in the front door. It's all part of the appeal to the restaurant. Once you get your table, the servers are attentive & the food arrives in a timely fashion. There is a view of the kitchen from some of the seating at the bar and booths. Further inside, you get a view of the Sinatra-like performer. There's also room room for larger parties. 

The food quality here is great. I'm not a huge fan of Italian food, but everything here is really good. Ma's meatballs is two huge meatballs served with sauce and peppers that add a nice spice. The lasagna portion is gigantic & my fave. The chicken parmigiana and chicken Marsala are tasty traditional choices, but I would recommend trying something more original like the chicken Anastasia. For dessert the turtle cheesecake hits the spot. 

The prices are $20-$30 for dinner, but the portions are huge so you'll likely have leftovers. If you get an appetizer, consider sharing an entree. They also have 2for1 Tuesdays to offset cost. I haven't been for lunch, but it looks like you can get a sandwich for $10, so not bad. I'd like to try the meatball sandwich someday!

I picked up a groupon for this as I love Italian food and who doesn't love the mafioso style of the place that I heard things about. It was cool walking in and the little hidden door, the man at the door was very funny and made a couple of jokes before letting me and my date in. Service was pretty good and the food was excellent. Nice and dimly lit, very comfortable place to go. Will certainly go back again.

From start to finish the food was amazing (life changing). The atmosphere is old Las Vegas with a flare of New York. Bobby the singer was great!! Jeremy our server was fantastic! Will definitely be coming back!

Now Ive never been to this location, but the original venue closed down. It disappointed me because the very first location was entertaining & classic. I know this place has live music too though. This fun mob italian place has huge portions! The people are nice & seem to know their menu. My pasta was delicious with lots of different italian toppings. Calamari plate itself would be good for 4 people. My boyfriend & I's bill was also good enough for 4 people (or more) LOL. The bread's butter is the best butter ever. It's like a honey butter. Also, beware of strong alcoholic drinks! I recommend this place if its anything like the old venue (Tropicana & Jones). It's a nice get-away from your stereotypical, Italian , mainstream restaurant.

I recently had the chance to have dinner here with a friend from out of town. I have heard many a story so off we went. 

   I found from other reviews that reservation are a sure fire way to go. so I made our reservations and got the password. Others had stated that with out a reservation there visit was not as enjoyable as it should have been. So off we went with password and info in hand..

  When you get there its just a rectangle building nothing fancy, and you really don't have to hunt for the door its pretty easy to spot. Once you enter the whole mob atmosphere is in full play. Dark mysterious and a bit unknown. I wont go into to much here as its an experience in itself, But ring the bell and wait...

    Once your inside, its a very lively place.. you enter by the bar and its all old school inside. and the matradee takes you to your table. Now had I known there where 2 rooms I would have requested the main room when placing my reservation. The back room is small and you can not see much if anything that is going on int he main area. Its also seems to be where the place you if you brought your kids..( which I do not recommend ). And it is right by the entrance to the kitchen so a bit busy and noisy. But it does have its own charm. 

   All the chairs and booths are covered in red velvet, which was a nice touch. The music is mostly from a live singer who is doing all the Sinatra hits for the era. We could hear him but not see him as he walks around and sings. 

   Now I had heard some really bad things about service, so I was prepared. We sat for a what seemed about 10 min with no one addressing us, I was hmmmm, but then a waiter came to the table and got our drink orders and appetizers. Did mention its dark in there? they give you little flash lights to read the menu by.. Thought is was different. The rest of the night waiter service was excellent. Never had to ask for anything. So slow start but nice recovery.

   They bring you out bread service, which is nice portion of a fresh sourdough. Or apps and salads where out in a rather timely fashion and where outstanding. I recommend the garlic bread and sauce, I don't know how they make the sauce but it was one of the best I have tasted in a long time. Our meals arrived to the table timed perfectly. The portions are large but not over bearing the plate. plenty to take home. Food was hot, plenty of sauce and delicious. Again the lasagna was fantastic and if you order a meatball its about the size of a softball..  Its a meal by itself.

    We where asked if we would like any desert and we passed as there just was no more room. we where not hurried at that point either. we finished our drinks and chatted a bit and then decided to head out. as we got up from our table we where thanked for coming in and we made our way to the main room. at this point we where escorted to the exit. Much like you would have been in the day. you exit through side doors to the parking lot. As we where leaving we took a few minutes and just looked around the room..  lots of old photos and posters.. you really get the feel that the Mob bosses may have been in a corner booth conducting business.. 

     I highly recommend you give it a try, if nothing else just for the experience. And don't forget the password!! the guy at the door doesn't like that..
Not what we expected. No magician, food and service mediocre, and hard to hear music in secluded room! Word of advice cater to guests that are there and not people you are hoping to come.
Great service!  Great staff!  Large portions!  Great atmosphere.  Love the entrance with the peep hole welcome!  Old school memorabilia gangster vibe.

My wife and I went on a Tuesday with two of our friends who are Vegas locals so at least we got the 2-for-1 deal.  Didn't like the darkness. I like to see what I am eating.  But maybe that was better,  because I didn't have to look at my chicken marsala that was drowned in what I think was a dark brown sauce the consistency of mud.  The mushroom risotto I got with it was bland and watery.  My wife got the chicken parm and left half of it on her plate.  The salads that came with the meal were tiny. 

Guess you are paying for the speakeasy theme because the prices they charge are way too high for what they give you,  plus you are forced to order way overpriced drinks to get the 2-for -1 deal.  Would have rather they had better food. The only things keeping it from a one-star review were the cheesy garlic bread,  the interesting way you enter the joint and the nice waitress.

We went for lunch on a Groupon and can't wait to try it for dinner. We loved the place from the ambiance to the food and the service. The service and food were both fantastic.
My wife and I are both Italian....The meatballs tasted just like the ones she makes. Great!!

Came here for lunch on a groupon. I had the meatball sandwich amazing! Cheesy and the aioli fries were out of his world. Boyfriend had the chicken Parmesan sandwhich can. He smashed it. His whole plate actually. Ambience is dark and romantic with old Mafia theme classy music and chandeliers. Been here for dinner once with a bachelorette party. Chicken was good and mushroom risotto was so good I almost cried. Lol Italian door and servers here are great. Definitely  coming back.
Great food, but not accomodating for large parties. Won't split the check and auto gratuity is also on tax. It's too bad because service is wonderful, ambiance is nice and food is delicious.
Brought some family from NYC for dinner. Everyone enjoyed every aspect of the dining experience. Old world veal parm. A packed house with smiling faces, good music and great service. My kind of place

Gimme a name...and a kick in the head. From the moment I called to make reservations, to the minute I left the joint - I was smiling. I called to make sure we wouldn't be turned away and the mobster that answered replied with a heavily Italian, "Gimme a name..."

We arrived on a Thursday for lunch. We found the secret entrance, gave the eyes in the doorway the code and were granted admission. The entire place is dimly lit and mob like. Red lights flash to alert them of new visitors and creaky wood floors keep people honest. We were seated right away, in a comfy booth adorned with a portrait of Al Capone. 

All the waiters wear white pressed long sleeve shirts and black trousers with suspenders. I selected the meatball sandwich, which came with a side salad. The sandwich was amazing. The best Italian I have ever had in my life. The creamy garlic dressing is so good, you will wish you could take a bottle home with you. From the drink list, I chose "Kick in the Head". We visited a nearby tiki bar a bit later and let me tell you -Capo's crafts a much better cocktail. It was delicious and carried just the right punch. 

My man selected the chipped Italian beef sandwich and again, we were blown away. It's as if they have taken good home cooking and elevated it to off the charts good. Their Chianti selection is also excellent. Service was great. 

We were there too early in the day for the piano player. I am already planning a return dinner trip, so that we can experience that. I have heard nothing but great things about him.

Came here with a groupon enticed by the Speakeasy theme. I am Italian and their meatballs are exquisite. Normally don't order pasta salad, but there's a must. Fresh and tasty not covered in Italian dressing. Love the secret entrance- won't ruin the fun by telling you what to look for. Love it and will definitely be back.

The food itself is actually of good quality and taste. However, the portions are small for their price. 

I made a reservation through OpenTable for my brother's birthday and made a note of it because he loves the mafia theme and the singers from the era. Unfortunately we were seated by the bar without any view, were told we couldn't move because the other spaces were booked (though I did see empty booths throughout the entire time we were there), and no one wished him a happy birthday (not that they needed to). 

The singer himself was great and I really wish we could have watched him perform. We won't be going back.

Had to give it a try because of all the hype. I do like the interior very much, classy mobster like, which is cool. Even getting into the "joint" you have to have a password. Kinda neat. 
Nico's Caesar salad was very good, I like the way the lettuce is cut really thin. I had Capone's Carbonara with chicken. For me, this isn't Carbonara. Too wet and I have to say, bland. Wife had Santucci's pasta. This was pretty good, sauce taste fresh and homemade. Had to ask for parmesan cheese. Been nice if it was fresh at the table. Also had garlic cheese bread, good but I couldn't taste garlic. Overall, I'll give it another try but I'll probably stay conventional, pasta and a meat ball.

Loved the calamari and cheese bread!!!! The salad was soft and fresh! I don't have a single complaint. By the time I got my delicious spaghetti, I had no room left! Loved the ambiance as well. Great people and good food!

It was hard to decide between 3 stars and 4 stars on this one.  I'd love it if Yelp had half stars because I think our experience was actually a 3.5.

The ambiance of the restaurant cannot be beat.  I've been to the Flamingo location many times and have always loved it.  I was happy to see that the decor and general atmosphere of the restaurant was very similar.  After being seated, our server took a while to take our order, but she was super friendly.  We ordered the antipasto appetizer, which is basically a salad, but an AMAZING salad!!  It was delicious.  Only problem was that salad came with our entrees as well.  Anyway, the antipasto salad was awesome.  Then our dinner salads came, both with blue cheese dressing, and they were pretty disappointing.  They lettuce was completely swimming in dressing and I didn't have more than a couple bites.  Maybe next time I will ask for dressing on the side.

My date ordered the ravioli trafficanti, and I ordered the rigatoni with arrabiatta and a meatball.  His dish was delicious!!!  Unfortunately, we were super full already at that point from bread and salad, we only ate one of the giant ricotta stuffed raviolis.  My dish was...just ok.  It wasn't bad, but there was absolutely NO wow factor.  The meatball was not GREAT, but definitely good.  The dish just looked and tasted like something I could make at home with boxed rigatoni and Prego sauce, and throw in some chili peppers.  Voila!  Next time, I will have to remember to order something more complicated.  I would say over all, the food was a 4.

Service.  The restaurant was not that crowded, but our server seemed to be running around like she was completely swamped.  She may have checked on us only once throughout our entire meal.  Before our entrees came, we ordered wine so that we could have it with dinner, but our entrees came and we ate them and our server finally came back and said the bar was backed up and our drinks would be coming soon.  We just told her to cancel them because we were done eating!  I looked at the bar and there were 3 people sitting at it and the bartender just putting glasses away and chatting with the barback.  Then she took forever to bring us our check, and to take it after we put our credit card in it.  Overall, the service kind of sucked.  That would be a 3.

So I'd give the restaurant in general a 3.5, but since we can't, sorry Capo's, I have to round down because it definitely was not a 4-star experience.  I've always loved this restaurant because of it's unique experience with the entry way, the Sinatra-like singer, and the ambiance, but this time was mildly disappointing.  I'd go back, but not anytime soon and it won't be on the top of my list.

A real Las Vegas treat is a visit to Capo's, this is one place you may have passed a thousand times before noticing, and even though you may have you weren't sure. This is my testimony to Capo's great tastes. 

I've been a handful of times, each dish is very special, perfectly cooked and flavors brought out perfectly. 

Their marinara sauce is to die for. :)

According to the owner, the old chef is at the new location on sahara.  We always have fun at capo especially people tend to loosen up when it's so dark.lol
Food is always good, love how they mix toasted garlic and fresh garlic together in most of the dishes.  One of my favorite italian restaurant in vegas especially when I have friends visit from other states.

Atmosphere was definitely 1930's/40's and food was excellent. The entertainment was a little loud, so it was hard to carry on a dinner conversation.  Friendly staff and food was served quickly.  Reservations is a good idea to guarantee seating.

Loved it all the way. I'm proud to say I've never been to an Olive Garden or any mainstream chain. Capos is on another level and out of the main drag for restaurants. 

It's dark when you go in but go with it. Make sure you are hungry or else you won't enjoy anything. The meatball appetizer satisfied my meat craving and then some. The Caprese was also just what I expected, just like my friend's mama's recipe. I had the linguini with clams and I made a mess, scarfing down everything and quaffing down some decent wine.

All I needed was a cigar and some strippers.

Always enjoy this restaurant because they show their appreciation for me stopping in. I'm a Las Vegas resident and have hundreds of choices for dining out yet this establishment never disappoints. Put a smile on, figure out how to get in, then enjoy a wonderful evening. Hint: I'm going on record here. Whatever you order is gonna be great, or else. Ask for Dominick or Nico.

Here's the low down :

Killer old school Vegas vibes & a dope spot to wow your guests. GO HUNGRY! Like don't eat all day to prepare, haha.

Here's a Capos order euphoria:

"Bust a Cap" - stuffed mushroom caps (you could share but prob will want to literally bust a cap so get your own!)

"Ma's Meat Balls & Peppers" - these are the real MVP!!!! I wasn't even a prior meatball fan, then this dish happened. (Def shareable portion)

"Stuffed chicken Anastasia" - GRADE A DELICIOUS!! Have the MUSHROOM RISOTTO as your side, trust me. 

Prepare to leave with a full belly and to go boxes.

I love everything about this place! From the entrance, the live singer, the ambiance, the staff, to the food. It's always so difficult to decide on my regular favorites, or try new things. The appetizer of meatballs with peppers is outstanding, as is Uncle Pauly's Arrabbiata. We came in for the prix lunch but being Sunday, we opted for brunch instead. The French toast is delicious, and we also enjoyed the salmon salad. Joel and Rachel are a fantastic asset to the team!

Came here for my bachelorette party before checking into the Chippendales show. This place is off the strip but worth a visit. I loved the ambiance of this place. We sat in a private room which was really nice but kind of a bummer because we could not see the Frank Sinatra performer on stage. He made our exit by stopping into our private room and singing a little bit for us which was pretty cool. This restaurant is very dark and speakeasy. Drinks are really good and the food, even better. The meatballs are HUGE and delicious! I ordered the pesto. No one complained about their dish, only that they were full. The only thing we didn't think of was he leftovers and portions. Since we were catching a show, we were unable to take any leftovers with us which was kind of a bummer since the portions are pretty family style. I would love to take more people here to experience it. The servers were really nice and helpful to our big party. 

My only negative comment is the flooring. I nearly broke my neck on the way to the private room. I hadn't even had a drink yet lol so it wasn't the booze. I was wearing very short heels and I stepped on a slippery section of wood taking me for a slip and slide. I caught myself so I didn't fall, but I skated past a table having dinner which was pretty embarrassing. My friend had the same thing happen to her but she was able to side-step it before sliding. It was just a really awkward piece of floor.

Other than that, I totally had a great time!

I made reservations 2 months ahead of time for my BF's bday. We arrived and they seated us in a back room which had one other table occupied. I noticed when we walked in that there was live entertainment and nice booth seating in the main dining area. We asked if we could be moved to that room and were quickly told that he spoke to mgr and those tables where reserved. hmmmm, I saw about 7 available booths!!! I asked to speak to manager. He came to our table and said he's see what he could do. He then sat us in a nice booth. Throughout the night I noticed not one other table was seated after us? Why would they lie about those booths being reserved? Weird. 
The food was OK and entertainment was great.

Capos is an interesting experience. First, the entrance will set the mood, but you'll get no spoilers from me. And yes, it is as creepy as the strip mall the restaurant is located in.

We came in at about 5:30 on a Sunday and the place was pretty quiet, but we were told that there were no tables available, only spaces at the bar. No problem, we took the bar. The bartender/waitress was extremely attentive and pleasant and honestly, she was probably the high point of the experience - she was awesome. 

The food is good but I have had better. We both ordered chicken parmigiana, and it was exactly what you want when looking for chicken parmigiana but priced higher. You can select your side dish from a few pre-set choices - I went safe for the spagetti on the side which was yummy, my boyfriend ordered mashed potatoes on the side (which, of course, I sampled - those were also good). 

The prices are a little steep for sitting at the bar and what you get, but the vibe is cool - very old school Mob. Note the chalk outline on the floor as you walk out.

My sister and I took our father to Capo's the night before Father's Day.  We made a reservation 2 days prior thinking it would be crowded, but it wasn't.
The food was delicious! 
Our server (Geri) was lovely and attentive. 
Our bus boy (Brandon) was courteous and quick. 
There was a really entertaining singer (Bobby Liguori) who was wonderful as well as a magician (Victor or "V") who did some good table side card tricks. 
A lady also came by with roses for sale. 
The atmosphere is mobster fun and the entire staff is friendly.  
The restrooms were clean.
We all enjoyed the experience very much and we will return again soon! 
Good job Capo's!!!

We had heard about Capo's on the TV show Man Finds Food before our trip to Vegas and it looked like a lot of fun (and the food reviews were very good). Capo's did not disappoint!

One note: it's a $50 cab ride from the Strip ($25 each way), but it was worth it, as the cost for a full dinner and drinks was about half what you'd pay in Strip restaurants.

This place is a hoot -- you have to ring a bell and then you're asked for a password to be let in (like the old Speakeasy's - very fun)
The restaurant is VERY dark, especially coming from the Vegas sun -- it's dark and very cozy with lots of half-booths. The décor is fun, photos of gangsters and Sinatra's mugshot.

There is a singer doing lounge songs, and he's pretty good!
Our waiter, Bruce, was great -- his personality fit the place perfectly. He gave us recommendations for dinner and wine.

For appetizer, we went with the bruschetta, which was very good. The bread was thin and toasty/crunchy and absorbed the yummy tomato topping, it was very light.

For dinner, hubby got the shrimp scampi with angel hair pasta -- the sauce was tasty, but the shrimp were over-cooked which was sad because the pasta was perfect.

I went with the recommendation of the chicken marsala with mushroom risotto -- it was just excellent and so delicious, a great combo together. The chicken was so tender you could cut with a fork and the marsala was thick and full of flavor. The risotto was a perfect match.

I am an Italian from Boston and I have not had a better Italian meal in the North End.

As we had ordered our apps, Hubby said "I know that waiter, we have seen him before" and then we realized that he had served us at the Range at Harrah's a few years back -- he had a personality that leaves a positive impression. We asked him and sure enough it was the same guy! He was thrilled that we had remembered him, he spent a few minutes telling us about what happened with the Range and how he ended up at Capo's. What a sweet guy, so genuine - he said he was so happy that we remembered him and you could tell he really meant it.

What a great experience - we will be back.

The only reason it's not 5 star is because of the over-cooked shrimp, other than that it was spot-on perfect!

We booked Capos for our wedding on May 14th. Janeen was such a pleasure to deal with . Its hard to plan a wedding from across the US, but Janeen always told me everything would be just fine! This is such a cool place, from the secret entrance to the red décor and the mobster pictures on the wall.  What a great follow up after our Elvis wedding! The Sinatra singer was great!  The food was really good too!  We had family style and everything came out as it should. Great service!  So happy we picked Capos for our wedding dinner!!!
On vacation in Vegas and heard about this place. The food is really good. I would make a reservation.

What fun! Heard about Capo's from a Vegas work friend. Took a group of 7 along with us. Getting in was a cool and fun experience. You need the word of the day to get through the speakeasy style doors. Once in there is a guy crooning Italian songs and an amazing card trick guy that visits your table. We were lucky enough to be placed in the "movie room" where Godfather was playing and posters of the movie adorned the walls. The food was AWESOME/ be sure to get the meatball appetizers. Our group had a variety of different items and all were excellent. Service rocked as well. Our server Janeen was fun and very attentive. Highly recommend this place for some off the strip dining!!

Unique lunch experience. Came in with a Groupon for half off but would gladly pay full price anyday. Service was great. Pasta dishes were delicious. Salad was a little limp but house garlic dressing was very tasty. Will revisit when in Vegas in the future

My wife joined me on a biz trip Vegas in January, an associate recommended Capo's so we tried it, it was a good experiance. I'm normally not much into theme restaurants but I DO like old ganster flicks so this was great. The speakeasy atmosphere is awesome, the service and staff are fantasico! We waited a few minutes at the bar, my odered a martini which she enjoyed. The waiter recommended a steak dish and since my wife loves steak we took him up n it, it was pretty good. We enjoyed the entertainment, a guy singing Sinatra and other old standards. It was a fun, memorable evening. I recommend it, it's a nice change of pace from the buffets and hotel restaurants on the strip.
We have been to Capo's many times..today was the first time for lunch... still a wonderful meal.. we will be back.. lots of specials .. and as a local we love that !!

My wife and I went there for our anniversary because we had heard it was a unique mob-themed Italian restaurant. When you first walk in, you're in a small room where you need to ring a buzzer to get in. A host opens a opens a small hatch to see who you are, then opens a hidden door behind the pay phone to let you in. We thought this was pretty neat because it gave it a real speakeasy feel to it. 

You walk through the hidden door and you'r in the restaurant. The lights are kept very dim, which adds to the mystic of the place. After allowing our eyes to adjust, you'll see old mob photos on the wall and the chefs cooking in the open kitchen next to the bar. 

The level of cheese elevated to a whole new level when we saw the music was coming from a gentleman singing from his karaoke set up. I can't make this up. He appeared to be a regular "attraction" because all the staff knew him. At one point his CD started skipping while he was singing "Quando, Quando, Quando". I told my wife he must be singing the remix version! He started the song over. I can only assume because he didn't want his artistic integrity compromised. This amused me on so many levels... who hires a karaoke singer as their entertainment? And more importantly... who uses CD's anymore???

Once we were seated at our table, the staff seemed very responsive and courteous. They did a good job of keeping our glasses full of water and clearing plates as we emptied them. The quality of food left a lot to be desired. The marinara sauce on my wife's pasta was cold, the picatta sauce was just so-so. The real laugher came with the side of risotto. Rather than taking the time needed to properly make it using arborio rice and slow cooking it, they steamed long-grain white rice, added some cheese and mushrooms, and called it "risotto". 

If you're looking for good Italian food, I'd rate this place somewhere below Sbarro's. If you're looking for a novelty restaurant with a so-so mob theme, then this is the place for you! Otherwise, save yourself the drive.

One of the best speak-easy Italian restaurants in Vegas.  The staff was very friendly and the food was excellent!  The atmosphere and the entertainment was great!  One of the most enjoyable parts was the singer who sang Sinatra hits throughout the night.  There was individual table entertainment as we waited for our food to be cooked as well  Ours was a magician who entertained us for a portion of time until our meal was completed.  

Awesome food.  We ordered two pasta plates, they were filling and delicious.  We ended up ordering the chocolate covered cannolis and those were magnificent as well.

We will definitely be visiting this hidden gem frequently.

Pro-tip - Let your server know you are a local for a discount.

Went here for a first date on Memorial Day. There was a live singer playing the piano while we ate our meal. The service was EXECELLENT. This restaurant reminded me of my days living in Brooklyn. It's got that "New York" feel about it. AND the food was great! 5 stars!

Have been to Capos a few times now, and have always thoroughly enjoyed the visit. If you cannot find your way in, it's the door with the big C on round back. Love the speakeasy entrance, host and all. The mob theme is a little overdone. Love the singer and the ambiance. Service was excellent, except he never did come back with the Parmesan cheese. The food won't win any awards but it was filling and tasty. I did enjoy my mushroom risotto. Everyone enjoyed the food, just perhaps didn't love it. It's great for locals with the twoferone Tuesdays, and great to bring visitors for a fantasy prohibition era Vegas night out.

I was a little scared at first when we entered the place, or tried to.  The door opens to a BOX.  Then a little window opens with an overbearing Italian sayin, "Ju gotta reserbation?"

We didn't but he let us in anyway since it was early.  Once inside, I was still scared.  it was DARK, like a fortune tellers den, kinda eery. 

We decided to stay and try it.  The service was a little slow to start, but they comped our drinks since they forgot us for the first few minutes. 
Their specialty drink menu has some GREAT drink combos that I had never seen before. 

I had eggplant parmesean with risotto and wedding soup.  It was excellent.  Hubby had Spagetti and Meatballs, said it was SPICEY but good.  The prices were EXPENSIVE over $20 for pasta plates, over $30 for protein plates. 

The singer was excellent.

I would have given higher reviews, but i'm not into the DARK lighting thing.  I had to take home leftovers to actually SEE what I ate. When its so dark,  maybe you don't clean so good....who knows.   Brighten it up a bit and I'll be back again and again.

Had reservation,went on double date w friends.door man/greeter whatever he might call himself was a complete douchebag!was on cellphone the whole time.we were told we couldn't be sat till whole party had arrive.then a group walk in behind us and was sat incomplete!!! Food was horrible,my entree was ice cold.two other entree were completely burnt.food is over priced.NO flavor,horrible service! only part that was okay, were drinks!and set up of restaurant (mob theme)!place is a joke!!!! don't bother nor waste your $

Good Italian food. There is a Capos in San Fran and I was hoping this was as good as that one. The meatball is for sure on point and worth everyone trying. They're very big. I had the calamari as well which was decent but nothing special. I got the pens with a red sauce. The red sauces was not as good as what I have had in North Beach in San Fran, but still good. Restaraunt definitely has an old school mob feel, with singers and mob movies playing in the background. I would definitely go back.

Food was excellent.  We got all appetizers, 8 for four of us.  Food was superb especially their shrimp cocktail (Napoli).  Very pleased with the food. It is NOT overpriced as one rater stated at all.

Food is Excellent, Service was as well and we enjoyed all very much. We will be back!

I come here at least once a month, and we always park it at the bar.  Gery and her team are the best, and the food is absolutely fantastic!  Do yourself a favor and try this place out, as it beats anything on the strip.
Took a date here on Thursday, July 3rd and had a great time.  The food was good, the service was excellent and we enjoyed the live music.  I would recomend the restaurant.

I love this place. Everything I have has been excellent especially the Stuffed Chicken Angelina. One of the best things I've ever had at any restaurant.  The singer they have is great and even comes to your table to serenade the ladies. We even had a magician come to our table one night which was a cool touch.

We travel all over the world and when we arrived at Capos we were very pleased! It was packed so we sat at the bar but the ambiance was terrific!
Food was WAY better than expected! Head off the strip for this Italian gem !!

I thoroughly enjoyed my meal at Capo's.  We came on a late rainy day and weren't sure if the restaurant was open on approach.  The windows were dimly lit but we proceeded to the door.  As other newbies, we were surprised by the entrance.  

We started out with a bruschetta and salad each.  The bread was really tasty.  I had the stuffed chicken Anastatia.  That dish was delicious and was a very huge portion.  It makes my mouth water just thinking about it.  I forgot what my partner had it was so good.

I went here with friends on the recommendation of a friend who lives in Las Vegas. It is set up as speakeasy and it's a fun experience. I won't go into all the details and spoil the experience, but it was a fun time. Beware that it is very dark inside the restauant, so if it is daylight when you go in, it will take a bit to adjust. 

Our server was pretty attentive. I had the eggplant parmesan with steamed  veggies and it was very good. Everyone at my table was happy with their meal. 

Overall good experience and I would recommend checking it out.

We decided to try Capo's for dinner. The ambiance is very nice. It is definitely very dark. I had to use my phone light to look at the menu. They had an impersonator singing and that was neat. We ordered 2 milks and the waitress brought us a cup of half and half mixed with water. It was disgusting. Apparently they don't carry milk. But the waitress could have said that instead of trying to trick us into drinking something that clearly wasn't milk. I went to order an item I saw off the online menu and the waitress told me they took that item off the menu 8 years ago. Really? They couldn't update their menu. It would take 5 minutes. I settled for the lasagna and I would say stouffer's is better. Our bill came to $103. My cocktail the size of a shot was $10. They charge strip prices with a Denny's quality type of food. I was very disappointed. I wish I had gone to Tbones and spent that money on quality dining. The air was broke in 105 degree weather. We were so hot and sweating sitting there. They should close the restaurant until that is fixed.
Love this place!!!  the atmosphere is the best, and the food is great!!  I cant wait to celebrate my 30th birthday there on April 10 @ the Sahara location =)

O M G!!  Dined here last night with another couple.  My girlfriend Victoria and I were celebrating the end of our first (and last) fight.  What a great experience (Capo's, not the fight).  

We had a reservation and were seated quickly after arrival, once we made past the door keeper.  That, in and of itself, is a trip!  We were given menus and water promptly.  The menus were thoughtfully provided with small flashlights to make reading them easier in the subdued lighting.  Overall the ambiance  is pleasant and the staff knowledgable, personable, and attuned to the needs of their guests.  The place does tend to get a bit noisy what with a vocalist performing and dozens of tables filled with happy diners so if you are looking for a quiet, intimate dinner you would be disappointed.  However, if you are looking for exceptional service, exceptional food, and exceptional entertainment, you won't find any better in Southern Nevada.  My girlfriend's husband had Shrimp Scampi, she had Chicken Picata with Garlic Risotto, my wife had Spaghetti with Meatball (it's a HUGE meatball), and I had Lasagna with Crumbled Meatball.  Every dish we were served was abundant and fabulous.  

As for the entertainment, the vocalist is a nice touch.  He performed well and visited several tables while singing.  And the magician, well he is an absolute WOW!  He performs table side and mystifies.  I named a playing card at random (the eight of diamonds) and it magically appeared out of the deck.  He handed it to me along with a Sharpie (which we all sniffed) and I signed it.  He then proceeded to amaze us all by having the card move through the deck, apparently at his will.  He also did things with coins and table settings that had the four of us just shaking our heads in wonder.  

So here is the bottom line on this place; if you are looking for a fine dining experience with peaceful, calm surroundings, pass this place by.  However, if what you are seeking is a dining experience encompassing great Italian food prepared like mama would fix it and served by attentive staff, an atmosphere where everyone is enjoying life and entertainment that by far exceeds the price paid for the meal alone, then you best get to Capo's sooner rather than later!
My husband and I had dinner here last night and the food is outstanding.  The Alfredo is amazing..... the atmosphere is unique and I highly recommend.

Nice atmosphere, except we had a table by the kitchen so I watched the waiters come in and out the whole time. Disappointing since it was my boyfriend's birthday dinner. Food was good, big portions. We also had the speak-easy element ruined by people exiting the restaurant, so they should mark the exit more clearly. We knew not to go out the entrance, but wandered a bit trying to find the actual exit.

The absolute worse!  Served me dead mussels (no, the shells were not open!), lousy service, loud, obnoxious singer who couldn't carry a tune in a paper bag, way too dark, even with the stupid menu lights, ridiculously overpriced.  This dump is not in New York City but tries to be.  If you like Italian food, go somewhere else (Olive Garden would be better and that's not saying much).  If you want Mafia environment, go to New York or Chicago.  This "movie set" needs to be run out of town!

There are so many good choices for Italian food in Vegas that a restaurant has to have something to set them apart from the rest.  Capo's has come up with a way to distinguish their "mobster" theme.  Guests arrive to an empty foyer with little besides a pay phone and a few framed pictures on the wall.  What is this?  You follow the directions and ring a bell, whereupon a secret hatch opens up and a Jersey-accented thug asks what we want.  After a little back-and-forth the wall holding the pay phone opens to a dimly-lit wonderland of mobster memorabilia.  It's lots of fun!  Walking past the kitchen you see the staff busily preparing the food.  This is pretty much the last you will see of the food at Capo's.

The atmosphere is super fun and the food was tasty too.  I would probably have given them more stars if I could have been able to see what I was eating.  The menus arrive with tiny lights attached to aid in actually reading them.  All around the dining room other patrons are using their cell-phones to catch a glimpse of what they are eating.  There is no reason for this place to be so dark.  Part of the culinary experience for me is to look at the presentation and I completely missed out on it at Capo's.  

The food and the concept are great!  Just shed a little light on it all and I think they'd have a five-star restaurant.

My partner and I came here because of the high reviews in Yelp. We were vacationing in Las Vegas and felt like Italian. What a huge surprise! When we got dropped off by the cab, we weren't so sure of our choice just based on the exterior of the building, and when we walked in the entrance, we were even less so. This is designed just like an old speakeasy. When you enter the door, it appears to be a dark closet with a keypad to punch in a secret code to enter. As we were puzzling over the keypad, a little hidden look-through panel popped open and the host greeted us (to our startled surprise!). He then opened a hidden door. When we stepped into the door, we walked into the 1920s!  It was amazing!

The atmosphere felt authentic with the exception of the large screen LCD where "Good Fellas" was playing. The walls were decorated with old gangsters and a very good singer was strolling the restaurant singing old Rat Pack songs.

The food was just as good as the atmosphere! Everything from the bread and salad, right down to the entree and dessert were delicious!

The staff was attentive while staying in role for the theme of Capo's. We highly recommend you check out this little gem off the strip of Vegas. It is well worth the trip!

I'm writing this review after the third time we have eaten dinner here. I can't say enough about the food, it's fantastic and made fresh to order. One of the best red sauces I have ever had! I asked them to make one of my favorites, chicken cacciatore, which isn't on the menu and they happily oblige. My wife gets the chicken marsala which she just loves. The ambiance is romantic, quite dark and always a lounge singer. The service is friendly, a little slow when they are busy but then again you don't come here to be in a rush. Always make a reservation and you can usually save a little money by finding their Restaurant.com or Groupon deal. Trust me on this one and give it a try, be better than the olive garden!

The ambience alone gets this place 5 stars.  From the unique entry to the Frank Sinatra-esque singer this place was so much fun.  The food was fantastic, we stuffed ourselves! Definitely worth taking a cab there.
Found a Groupon online & came in for lunch to redeem it. Very cool place, atmosphere is relaxing & elegant and best of all is the service. My husband & I will definitely be coming back!

Excellent : service (Jeremy- five stars and thank you for the smile, sir!!), Food, drinks, decor, live music, & ambiance! Highly recommend coming here if you're visiting ~ or if you're local.  This was my and my BFs first time to Vegas and to Capos. We had a great time!!  On a personal note , I would have paid someone to turn off the TVs.  We are All guilty of looking at flashing screens and it would have been perfect if when my BF and I sat at the bar he wasn't tempted to check the score (which he did... And then forgot to converse with me ). Just a preference! It seems we can't escape screens in this day and age and I was just so looking forward to a night of just his full attention haha.  Overall - when Rob and I come back to Vegas we will definitely be visiting you all again and enjoying every bit! Thank you!
